meanings.definition: To struggle or wrestle with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The siblings were warstling over the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The two friends decided to warstle playfully in the backyard.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog were warstling for the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the trees warstled in the wind during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The waves warstled against the shore, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in physical combat or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The warstling between the two knights was intense.
meanings.sent2: The warstling in the ring captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The warstling for the last piece of cake was fierce at the party.
meanings.sent4: The warstling of ideas in the debate room was thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The warstling of colors in the painting created a beautiful contrast.

meanings.definition: A form of competition or sport involving physical strength and skill.
meanings.sent1: The annual warstling tournament drew participants from all over.
meanings.sent2: Warstling is a popular sport in this region.
meanings.sent3: The warstling match ended in a surprising victory for the underdog.
meanings.sent4: The warstling of strategies in the game was intense.
meanings.sent5: The warstling of flavors in the dish created a delightful taste.
